channel.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
channel.description:
Jewel Collector is a game developed by myself, graphically created by Archer, and had sound done by Adam Cooper. It is a simple arcade game that was started a few days ago, and all in all, took 3 days to complete.
You can download it here: http://jc.telenubby.info/JewelCollector.jar
You can play it as an applet here: http://jc.telenubby.info/index.html
You can view the documentation on it here: http://jc.telenubby.info/doc
The source, binary files, resources, and documentation are also included inside of the Jar file. The source code is not licensed, so you may edit and redistribute it freely. However, we ask that you still accredit us for creating the original version, but you are not forced to do so.
I have fixed all of the bugs and added all of the updates you commented on for version 1, so if you have anymore, let me know and I will see what I can do. This game is not perfect, but it is pretty good and is quite fun.
Additions:
[ul][li]Added speed boosting feature (collect gold coins and rings, then hold down control while moving)[/li] [li]Added music (with the assistance of Adam Cooper, who made it)[/li] [li]Added right/left sprites for the character[/li] [li]Modified About/Help section[/li] [li]Added documentation to source code[/li] [li]Fixed applet[/li] [li]Fixed concurrency issues (for the most part)[/li] [li]And maybe a few other things I can't remember[/li][/ul]
PS: Post your high scores here
My record: [img]http://img409.imageshack.us/img409/8345/recordxs1.png[/img]
And, to solve a problem before it starts, yes, I am fully aware that the music cuts off when using the applet. Just don't worry about it.

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Trigger*, post:19, topic:227686”]It is going 3 kb a second, other downloads are going fine.[/quote]As it is my host, I decided to test it myself to see what was up. Well, as of this post, it’s working fine (no idea if it wasn’t cooperating properly earlier). But I just downloaded that at an average of 250kb/sec and the file size is 7.8mb. Didn’t take too long, and I think it’s just you.

Read full topic

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:14, topic:227686”]Yea… indeed.

How come the music only breaks in the applet?[/quote]

I am using the default applet music system when playing music. When running it locally, the applet wrapper class (JCFrame) implements the media classes for the applet and uses the media system from [tt]javax.sound.sampled[/tt]. Apparently the default media player in the applet system that the browsers uses doesn’t behave the same way the javax.sound.sampled does. Doesn’t really matter though.

Read full topic

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:8, topic:227686”]some gems still are unreachable (too low), and, for some reason the music (which is pretty neat) stopped after a few screens.

Good you fixed those other bugs, tho.[/quote]

Music breaks only on the applet version, and the gem fix is simple yet I’m too lazy to do it. I think its fine for a basic arcade game, but the programming is nasty.

Read full topic

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

The movement is annoying… And here’s a flaw 

Exception in thread "RenderLoop" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
        at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.checkForComodification(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(Unknown Source)
        at JewelManager.checkCollision(JewelManager.java:78)
	public final int[] checkCollision(int x, int y) {
		for (Jewel jewel : jewelsList) {
			if (jewel.collidesWith(x, y)) {
				jewelsList.remove(jewel);

Read full topic

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

It’s kinda funny. I get about 30 fps.

bugs/‘bad’ things:

  1. What TeleNubby said
  2. After I got destroyed by the evil gems, and want to play again, I can’t. When I start playing I get destroyed again.
  3. It moves down much too fast O_o

Oh, and sound would be cool…

Read full topic

item.title: Jewel Collector [Modified and Improved]
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I somewhat enjoyed playing it, actually.

But by the fourth level, I got bored and just zipped through it without collecting any jems. I ended up dieing by the purple jem monsters or whatever.

Couple of bugs/pointer-outters:

  1. Character does not face the other way (to the left)
  2. Character does not jump the other way (to the left)
  3. On level four it shows the slide number as n/0 (shows 0 as ending slide)

I get about 21 fps. Anyone else get higher/lower?

Read full topic
